column4: Ok, How do I get a DETAILD analysis of the disk usage? df -h shows a very "overall" picture
Ok, How do I get a DETAILD analysis of the disk usage? df -h shows a very "overall" picture
I've used it but it omits a lot of usage information is there a more SERIOUS disk analyzer
you will have to say what usage information you want to see.
afaics disk analizer can give you a overview of disk usage and "zoom" in to any folder in the system
Thanks! I will try it now :-)
Are you sure about the disk analyzer name? I can't google it.
i was talking about the one in accesories
sorry ;) afaics <--> as far as i can see
the disk usage analyzer only shows me 13.5 GB of the whole 105GB, and the df -h omits usage information just as well.
ido_ or scan folder and you will see
that is what I did - "scan filesystem" only showed me a 13.5GB as my overall usage
you can then see where the space is being used using the tree view in the left pane
you can click in each folder and see the size etc
but only 13,5 giB are bien used? or there is a misunderstanding here ?
